text:
Hi !
What is the best way to update a theme for a customer after a purchase?

I've seen that some Themes host files externally to provide a update functionality. This may work for _JS_ and _CSS_ files. But not for _Modules_ or _Markup_ files.

Versions can be specified as Query-Parameters on the URL:
```<link type="text/css" src="/css/file.css?v=1.2.3" />
<script src="/scripts/file.js?v=4.5.6" />```
So you can identify the client or used client file version.

Hi there,

I’m think about creating a small theme as a pet project mainly to learn the CLI, DnD-Stuff and get my creative juices flowing. But it would be nice to see it in the marketplace at some point as well.

I’ve read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/marketplace-requirements|Guidelines> already but was wondering how hard the review process is. Does someone here have some experience with the process?

Cheers,

I would look into child themes. See this here <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1617397068037500?thread_ts=1617397068.037500&cid=CEQQ9NFK2|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1617397068037500?thread_ts=1617397068.037500&cid=CEQQ9NFK2>

Hi <@U01222R6Y95>
Great question!
I had some sort of that experience. Last year I uploaded two templates. Those were system pages. Great material for a pet project. Submission process was flawless back then.
However, it might have changed recently due to the themes being introduced.
So I’d also like to hear someone else with the experience of submitting a theme :blush:

Yeah I think it changed a bit at least. My idea was to create a Landing Page Pack first but HubSpot doesn’t take any more submissions for them. Only themes, modules and email templates. 

Just hope when I invest the time I can share it on the marketplace as well. 

What system pages did you upload?

Here are they
<https://app.HubSpot.com/marketplace/7813309/products/gozha-net/404>
<https://app.HubSpot.com/marketplace/7813309/products/gozha-net/500>

Just some fun stuff to warm up creative and coding muscle. Try to hover on the links here :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://7813309.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=true&portalId=7813309&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_layout_id=29902289776&updated=1590919637850&hs_preview_key=Jtkfl4nqfMS_ZEuqSHtSZw|https://7813309.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=t[…]pdated=1590919637850&hs_preview_key=Jtkfl4nqfMS_ZEuqSHtSZw>
Do modules not get overwritten in child themes? I have the same module showing up twice
Also there in no easy way to 'share' a global module with the child, it pull the same global content. Hence why I'm trying to overwrite it ^
Is there any plans to allow for more than one child theme?
Use Case: some client have multiple micro sites on the same portal, so allowing them to have more that just one child theme would be great
